info.title: Trimble Connect Topics API with BCF 2.1 and 3.0 compatibility
info.description:
# Overview
A [BCF 2.1](https://github.com/buildingSMART/BCF-API/tree/release_2_1) and [BCF 3.0](https://github.com/buildingSMART/BCF-API/tree/release_3_0) compatible service.

Documentation for this service is available on the [Trimble Developer](https://developer.trimble.com/docs/connect/topics) site.

# Getting started
**You must agree to the [Terms of Service](https://developer.trimble.com/docs/connect/terms) to use Connect services.**

You need to complete the steps in the [Getting started](https://developer.trimble.com/docs/connect/getting_started) guide to be able to call the API.

# Concepts
Please see [Common Concepts](https://developer.trimble.com/docs/connect#common-concepts) in the Connect Platform documentation.

## Paginated Responses (BCF 2.1)

All endpoints that return collection of resources follow the same schema for query parameters and
response structure to paginate the results.
Pagination allows to limit the size of the large responses and aimed to improve the responsiveness and overall
performance when fetching large result sets. The overall latency is improved
by parallelization of data processing and transfer.

The requests accept `top` and `skiptoken` query parameters.

`skiptoken` is a token used for pagination, typically returned with the previous page, and should be used as-is without interpretation.
If the `skiptoken` query parameter is not specified, the first page of the result set is returned.

The `top` parameter informs the server on how many items client
wants to receive in a single page. Server returns the requested number of items
if they are available or less (for the last page in the result set).
If `top` parameter is not specified then the server returns maximum page size by default.

Additionally, the response header contains a `next` field, which is a URL that points to the next page of items.

## Paginated Responses (BCF 3.0)

Pagination follows [OData v4](http://www.odata.org/documentation/) standard.

Service supports server-driven pagination in which it returns to the client the next page URL by providing `odata.nextLink` in the response header.

## Syncing Extensions

In addition to BCF-API compatibility, the service provides Topics Syncing extensions that are useful in various cases,
such as a temporary loss of internet connection.

## Limitations

Currently, the following BCF-API standard features are not supported:
- OData sorting and filtering data
- Viewpoint Bitmaps
- Topic BIM Snippets
- OData pagination on the BCF 2.1 endpoints
- Topics Events
- Comments Events

get.description:
Retrieve a specific projects extensions. Project extensions are used to define possible values that can be used in topics and comments, for example topic labels and priorities.
They may change during the course of a project. The most recent extensions state which values are valid at a given moment for newly created topics and comments.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The id of the Trimble Connect Project

200.description:
The response format varies based on the `Accept` header value in the request.

| Accept Header Value                              | Response Format                      |
|--------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------|
| Not provided or `application/json`               | Pure BCF 3.0 representation          |
| `application/vnd.trimble.connect.app+json`       | Connect representation               |

400.description:
Bad Request.
Possible reasons include:
- Path parameters passed in a format that is not supported

401.description: Authorization information is missing, invalid or expired.

403.description: User has no permissions to execute this operation.

404.description:
Not Found - The requested resource could not be found.
Possible reasons include:
- `project_id` in path parameter not found

put.description:
**`This API is an extension for Trimble Connect and is not part of the BCF standard.`**

Update the extensions of a specific project.
The extensions are used to define possible values that can be used in topics, for example topic labels and priorities.

get.description:
Retrieve a collection of file references as topic header.
Implementer Note: The reference property can either be an Uri or a server specific id.
Uris are given as absolute paths to the model files while ids reference a custom id of the model file and require custom logic per server to retrieve it.
This allows referencing of files on the server but requires clients to know how to retrieve files in a specific implementation.

example.description: The building owners global design parameters for buildings.
The building owners global design parameters for buildings.

400.description:
Bad Request.
Possible reasons include:
- Path parameters passed in a format that is not supported

401.description: Authorization information is missing, invalid or expired.

403.description: User has no permissions to execute this operation.

Not Found - The requested resource could not be found.
Possible reasons include:

- `topic_id` in path parameter not found

post.description:
Add a document reference to a topic. This operation is only possible when the server returns the updateDocumentReferences flag in the Topic authorization, see section 4.2.8

Should either reference an internal or an external document.

Internal
document_guid must match an existing document in the project
url must be null
External
document_guid must be null
url must be the url to the external resource

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The id of the Trimble Connect Project

400.description:
Bad Request.
Possible reasons include:
- Invalid request body
- Path parameters passed in a format that is not supported
- Both `url` and `document_guid` are either null or not null at the same time.
  - For an internal document reference, `document_guid` must be provided and `url` must be null.
  - For an external document reference, `url` must be provided and `document_guid` must be null.

401.description: Authorization information is missing, invalid or expired.

403.description: User has no permissions to execute this operation.

404.description:
Not Found - The requested resource could not be found.
Possible reasons include:
- `project_id` in path parameter not found
- `topic_id` in path parameter not found

409.description: Conflict - The resource could not be created because the specified GUID already exists in the target system.

put.description:
Update an existing document reference identified by guid. Uses the same rules as POST Document Reference Service.
This operation is only possible when the server returns the updateDocumentReferences flag in the Topic authorization, see section 4.2.8

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The id of the Trimble Connect Project

400.description:
Bad Request.
Possible reasons include:
- Invalid request body
- Path parameters passed in a format that is not supported
- Both `url` and `document_guid` are either null or not null at the same time.
  - For an internal document reference, `document_guid` must be provided and `url` must be null.
  - For an external document reference, `url` must be provided and `document_guid` must be null.

401.description: Authorization information is missing, invalid or expired.

403.description: User has no permissions to execute this operation.

404.description:
Not Found - The requested resource could not be found.
Possible reasons include:
- `project_id` in path parameter not found
- `topic_id` in path parameter not found

post.description:
Creates a document reference. This can be a document inside the project (identified by the document_guid) or an external reference (identified by the url).
 
You can also add a Trimble Connect clashset by prefixing the clashset id with 'CLASH-'.
 
You can also add a Trimble Connect model object by prefixing the model object id with 'OBJECT-'.
 
Note: 'url' and 'document_guid' are mutually exclusive
 
Sample request (for a document belonging to the project):
 
    POST projects/{projectId}/topics/{topicId}/document_references 
    { 
        "document_guid": "LC0Ilxg7jtU", 
        "description": "Sample file.txt" 
    } 
Sample request (for a clashset belonging to the project):
 
    POST projects/{projectId}/topics/{topicId}/document_references 
    { 
        "document_guid": "CLASH-aA5cGgOKj24", 
        "description": "Clashset Report 1" 
    } 
Sample request (for a model object belonging to the project):
 
    POST projects/{projectId}/topics/{topicId}/document_references 
    { 
        "document_guid": "OBJECT-aA5cGgOKj24", 
        "description": "I-Beam 01" 
    } 
Sample request (for an external url):
 
    POST projects/{projectId}/topics/{topicId}/document_references 
    { 
        "url": "http://example.com/files/LegalRequirements.pdf", 
        "description": "LegalRequirements.pdf" 
    }

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The id of the Trimble Connect project

parameters.name: topicId
parameters.description: The id of the topic

requestBody.description: The document reference to be created.

400.description: Request is invalid.

post.description:
Creates a new Topic for the specified Trimble Connect Project.
 
Sample request:
 
    POST Projects/{projectId}/Topics 
    { 
        "title": "Clash between pipes", 
        "topic_type": "Inspection", 
        "description": "More details needed", 
        "assigned_to": "Assignee_Name@trimble.com", 
        "assigned_to_uuid": "c5a73cc9-b155-4556-8963-bc7dc13c6fd2", 
        "topic_status": "Not Started", 
        "reference_links": [ "https://www.google.com", "https://www.trimble.com" ], 
        "labels": [ "Road", "Electrical" ] 
    }

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The id of the Trimble Connect Project

parameters.name: validation
parameters.description:
A flag to customize the validation behavior.
 
Use 'add' to add new values from the new topic to the project extensions.
 
Use 'replace' to replace the topic values not present in the project extensions with current default values from the project extensions. If there is no default value, no value will be set.
 
Use 'strict' to validate the topic values against the current project extensions values (this is the default behavior). If the topic values are not found in the project extensions, it will result in a validation error.

400.description: Request is invalid.

401.description: Authorization information is missing or invalid.

403.description: User has no permissions to execute this operation.

404.description: The specified projectId was not found.

get.description:
Gets a paginated list of objects of specific type (topics, comments, viewpoints or documentReferences). 

 Only active topics and related objects are returned by default. If all objects needs to be fetched the *fetchAll* query parameter can be used. 

 Note that single request can return objects of a single type only. Since objects of different types have relations between them, client must be prepared for references pointing to the objects that the client does not know about yet. All missing references should be eventually resolved by fetching objects of needed types again.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The id of the project.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
The type of objects to fetch. One of the following values:

 **topic** - to fetch topics. 

 **comment** - to fetch comments.

 **viewpoint** - to fetch viewpoints.

 **documentReference** - to fetch document references.

 When fetching topics child resources (viewpoints, comments, or document references), it's essential to verify if the associated parent topic linked through the topic GUID in the child resource was already fetched. 

 In rare cases where the parent topic was not available while fetching, the topics should be re-fetched.

parameters.name: fetchAll
parameters.description: Specifies whether to fetch all or only active objects. If missing, only active objects are fetched during initialization.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to be returned on a single page. The response must not contain less than this quantity of items unless it is the last page. If requested pageSize exceeds the max limit supported, then the request will fail with an error message. Note that max items limit might be increased in the future, clients should not make any assumptions on the number of items returned by default.

parameters.name: skiptoken
parameters.description: The token used for pagination. Typically returned with the response in the previous page and should be used as-is without interpretation.  When provided in a subsequent request, it instructs the server to skip over a specified number of items from the beginning of the result set, allowing you to paginate through a large set of data.

204.description: No objects of requested *type* have yet been defined for this project.

400.description: The request contains malformed syntax and cannot be understood by the server

401.description: Authorization information is missing or invalid.

403.description: User has no permissions to execute this operation.

404.description: The specified projectId was not found.

get.summary: Fetch changes of Topics related objects
get.description: Gets project content changes since the last fetch (in regards to the *type* query parameter). No filtering is possible unlike in [**List Objects**](#/Topics%20Syncing/ListObjects). This API method returns a paginated list of objects of specific type (topics, comments, viewpoints or documentReferences) that were created, modified or deleted since the last known state. The objects are fetched using a cursor (changeToken) that represents a position in the stream, pointing to the last object (of the specified type) that has already been fetched.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The id of the project.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
The type of objects to fetch. One of the following values:

 **topic** - to fetch topics. 

 **comment** - to fetch comments.

 **viewpoint** - to fetch viewpoints.

 **documentReference** - to fetch document references.

 When fetching topics child resources (viewpoints, comments, or document references), it's essential to verify if the associated parent topic linked through the topic GUID in the child resource was already fetched. 

 In rare cases where the parent topic was not available while fetching, the topics should be re-fetched.

parameters.name: changeToken
parameters.description:
A cursor pointing to the last known change of the objects (defined by the *type* query parameter). 

 *ChangeToken* format is implementation detail of the service and must not be used or modified by client. The client should only pass the *changeToken* as it is received in ListObjects or previous fetch response.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to be returned on a single page. The response must not contain less than this quantity of items unless it is the last page. If requested pageSize exceeds the max limit supported, then the request will fail with an error message. Note that max items limit might be increased in the future, clients should not make any assumptions on the number of items returned by default.

parameters.name: skiptoken
parameters.description: The token used for pagination. This is returned with the response in the previous page and should be used as-is without interpretation. When provided in a subsequent request, it instructs the server to skip over a specified number of items from the beginning of the result set, allowing you to paginate through a large set of data.

204.description: No objects of requested *type* have yet been defined for this project.

400.description: The request contains malformed syntax and cannot be understood by the server

401.description: Authorization information is missing or invalid.

403.description: User has no permissions to execute this operation.

404.description: The specified projectId was not found.

assignees.description:
The `assignees` is a Connect-specific extension of the `assigned_to` property specified by the BCF standard, making it possible to have multiple assignees.
Note that when both `assignees` and `assigned_to` are set in the request body, `assignees` will override `assigned_to`.

id.description: The Trimble Connect Id of the assignee.

url.description: Note that this property should be named `referenced_document` according to the [BCF standard v2.1](https://github.com/BuildingSMART/BCF-API/tree/v2.1#47-document-reference-services). However it is named `url` to match the new naming introduced in the [BCF standard v3.0](https://github.com/buildingSMART/BCF-API#37-document-reference-services).

ErrorResponse.description: The error response body. Defines a standard for reporting errors to the client.

snapshot_data.description: Base64 encoded string of the snapshot image.

changeToken.description: The new cursor value for subsequent fetches. When the same requested cursor value is returned in the response, it indicates that no objects of the specified type have been created in the project yet. In this scenario, retrying the same API later is necessary to check for any newly created objects.

items.description: The objects changed since the last changeToken. This may be empty if there are no changes since the last changeToken.

deletedItems.description: The objects deleted since the last changeToken. This may be empty if there are no deletions since the last changeToken.

SyncObjectList.description: The list of objects with changeToken

PageLinks_self.description: A URL that will retrieve the response that was just received.

PageLinks_first.description: A URL that will retrieve the first page of results.

PageLinks_next.description:
A URL that will retrieve the next page of results. Responses that include only a partial set of the items identified by the request will contain a link that allows retrieving the next partial set of items. 

 This link is called a next link. Clients should treat the URL of the next link as opaque, and should not append system query options to the URL of a next link. 

 The url returned by server might be an absolute url or path with query parameters. 

 If it is a path, client is responsible for adding a hostname to form a full url. 

 Otherwise no transformations must be applied by the client to the url and it should be sent as is to the server to fetch the next page of events.
